titlestmt.titleproper: David Rockefeller papers, Photographic Collection, Numbered Albums
A Guide to the David Rockefeller papers, Photographic Collection, Numbered Albums FA1316
titlestmt.author: Amy R. Fitch

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-01 03:20:29 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: David Rockefeller papers, Photographic Collection, Numbered albums

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Materials related to living members of the Rockefeller family are restricted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The albums in this collection primarily contain images of David Rockefeller (DR) with his family, friends, personal office staff, or Chase Manhattan Bank colleagues during his travels throughout the globe. A second common album theme is DR with Peggy, his wife, at one of their homes: Hudson Pines in Pocantico Hills, New York; their townhouse on East 65th Street in Manhattan; Ringing Point in Seal Harbor, Maine; or Colombier, on St. Bart's, in the Caribbean. However, there are also hundreds of images from DR's childhood and from his service in Europe during World War II.

The timeframe of the albums ranges from as early as DR's infancy, approximately starting in 1916, and goes throughout his lifetime, with the last album created in 2016. Of particular note are the albums from David's youth, including images he took while on family vacations. During his undergraduate years (mid-1930s), he traveled in Europe with his camera in hand. Then during World War II, he was stationed with the U.S. Army in France and took images while on leave in several countries.

By the 1950s, DR traveled internationally on behalf of his employer, Chase Manhattan Bank. The albums of his visits to several African nations are among the earliest images documenting those activities. His interest in Latin America is evident as early as the 1950s in this collection. After his retirement in 1980, DR continued to represent Chase Bank as a member of its International Advisory Committee (IAC), which led to further travel and albums from many of those trips. In the latter part of the 20th century, DR was described as an unofficial diplomat for the United States. The images found throughout this collection that depict his numerous meetings with heads of state attest to this informal but significant capacity and the lasting connections he made in all of his roles.

For each box, the contents of the album within are broadly described, along with details on the number of images and approximate date. Most images are prints, although there is a large aggregate of slides from mid-century. All images are in color unless otherwise noted.

Lastly, the albums with material related to living members of the Rockefeller family are restricted from research access during each individual's lifetime. Therefore, approximately 45 percent of the collection of albums remains restricted at this time even though there is description available in this finding aid. The archival staff will conduct periodic reviews to open additional albums and update this finding aid.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged as received. These albums are in no discernible order, although some portions of the finding aid reflect semi-alphabetical runs of travel destinations. Sometimes trips to the same location over a range of years are in consecutive boxes, but that is not the general rule. At times, similar formats are grouped in a range of boxes. For example, most of the slides are located between Box 279 and Box 292, although a few are elsewhere in this collection. Albums on specific destinations (such as Seal Harbor, Maine) or events (such as DR's 100th birthday celebrations) appear throughout the collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Jeddah on behalf of Chase Manahttan Bank's International Advisory Committee. He met with Abdul Aziz Al-Sulaiman, chair of ROLACO, a trading and contracting company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR visit to Colonial Williamsburg, VA, with family members. DR met with Colin Campbell, director of Colonial Williamsburg, and toured the site.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR with their children at Hudson Pines, their home in Pocantico Hills, New York. Images of horseback riding, playing with pets, posing in the garden, posing in the living room, posing at the front staircase.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR trip to their home, Colombier, on St. Bart's in the Caribbean. Guests included Henry Kissinger, Nancy Kissinger, Robert Douglass, Linda Douglass, Winston Lord, and Bette Bao Lord.

did.unittitle: Chase Manhattan Bank Art Program, Tenth Anniversary Celebration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chase Manhattan Bank celebrated the tenth anniversary of its art program by hosting a dinner for the artists whose works appeared in their buildings. DR and PR hosted. Alfred Barr Jr. attended. Artists included Isamu Noguchi, Marisol, and Robert Indiana. Images and clippings.

did.unittitle: Dartmouth V International Conference, Party at Pocantico Playhouse, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR hosted at party at the Playhouse for the attendees of the Dartmouth V International Conference, which was held in Rye, New York. Topics included cultural and scientific exchanges, arms controls, the United Nations, Vietnam, and the Middle East. Paticipants were from the United States and the Soviet Union. Happy Rockefeller attended the party.

did.unittitle: Estate Fountain Valley Golf Course, St. Croix

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Promotional images for golfing and sightseeing at Estate Fountain Valley, St. Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands.

did.unittitle: FLF Hudson Pines, Celebration of Francois de Rose's 90th Birthday

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR's friend from his years in the Army during World War II. Francois de Rose and Ivonne de Rose visited DR at Hudson Pines and the 65th Street townhouse while in the United States to celebrate Mr. de Rose's 90th birthday. They also toured Rockefeller Center, Museum of Modern Art, and the Union Church at Pocantico Hills. Henry Kissinger, Nancy Kissinger, and Donald Rumsfeld were guests at the dinner celebration.

did.unittitle: Fort Worth, Texas, Reception for Lady Bird Johnson and Peggy Rockefeller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Exhibition at the Amon Carter Museum in Fort Worth and reception at the Ridglea Country Club to celebrate publication of "Wild Flowers of the United States, Volume Three: Texas." Attendees included DR and PR, former President Lyndon Johnson, Lady Bird Johnson, Ruth Carter Stevenson, and Van Cliburn.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR on a hunting and fishing trip along the George River. Visit to local community school and church.

did.unittitle: Middle East Trip for Chase Manhattan Bank, 1980

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to 7 countries on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank, along with Joseph Reed and Robert Douglass: Morocco, Egypt, the Sudan, Saudi Arabia, Jordan, Cyprus, and Israel. They toured historical and religious sites, markets, and the Great Pyramids. DR met with Menachem Begin and Moshe Dayan while in Israel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR travels with granddaughter to London, Rome, and Paris. Visits to Salisbury Cathedral, St. Peter's Basilica and Square, Colosseum, and Forum.

did.unittitle: Retirement Party at Playhouse for Alfred Barr

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR hosted a retirement party for Alfred Barr, director of the Museum of Modern Art, at the Playhouse in Pocantico Hills, New York. Attendees included Rene d'Harnoncourt, Nelson Rockefeller, Happy Rockefeller, John D. Rockefeller 3rd, Blanchette Rockefeller, and Dorothy Miller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This compilation album of professional photos was a Christmas gift to DR from Gregory Hudson. The photos are of the flowers and plants at the Abby Aldrich Rockefeller Garden in Seal Harbor, Maine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR trip with friends for Thanksgiving weekend to Colombier, their home on St. Bart's in the Caribbean. Sailing, hiking, wildlife.

did.physdesc: Black-and-white images, plus a few clippings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chase Manhattan Bank sponsored an art show held at the Martha Jackson Gallery in Manhattan, with a benefit opening to support the Studio Museum in Harlem. The museum celebrates African American artists. The event also marked the tenth anniversary of Chase Bank's art program, so the bank pledged to buy any unsold works for its own collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR visit to Southern Island, Maine, home of artist Andrew and Betsy Wyeth. Son Jamie Wyeth, also an artist, is present.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: During the summer of 1955, DR attended a men's retreat at a private redwood forest campground, Bohemian Grove, in Sonoma County, California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Visited 7 African countries in 5 weeks (in order): Nigeria, Ghana, Belgian Congo, South Africa, Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland, Kenya, and Republic of Sudan.

did.unittitle: U.S. Army Service, Photos by David Rockefeller during World War II

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: During World War II, DR served in the U.S. Army and was stationed in northern Africa and France. He took most of these photos in areas where he was stationed or traveling to while on leave.

did.unittitle: 10 Nations Africa Trip, Chase Manhattan Bank

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Trip to 10 African nations with members of DR's staff and Chase Manhattan Bank staff. Two of the ten countries visited are Ivory Coast (Cote d'Ivoire) and Nigeria. DR met with Henry Konan Bedie and Felix Houphouet Boigny, both former presidents of Cote d'Ivoire. In Nigeria, DR met with Ado Abdullahi Bayero, Emir of Kano. Hughlyn F. Fierce also joined the group.

did.unittitle: Australia and Papua New Guinea Trip, Part 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR trip to Australia for meetings of the International Advisory Committee (IAC). Henry Kissinger also attended the meeting in Sydney. The Rockefellers then visited their properties at Orleans Farms and Oceanview Farms, and then they took boat and helicopter trips along the Kawarari River and Sepik River, Papua New Guinea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR trip to their property at Orleans Farms in Esperance, Western Australia. A side trip during a business trip to Australia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Caracas, Venezuela, to receive the medal for the Order of Don Andres Bello. Presented by President Carlos Andres Perez at the Palacio de Miraflores. Awarded for service to the arts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip for Chase Bank International Advisory Committee to Caracas, Venezuela. Part of Latin American trip that included Brazil, Ecuador, and Mexico. While in Caracas, DR stayed at the guest house of his friend Gustavo Cisneros. He visited with U.S. Ambassador George Landau, and he was presented with the Order of Francisco de Miranda by President Jaime Lusinchi at the Palacio de Miraflores. The award is for contributions to the sciences, to the progress of the country, or to the humanities.

did.unittitle: Turkey and Israel Trip with Council on Foreign Relations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip with delegation from the Council on Foreign Relations to Turkey and Israel. DR was co-chair of the delegation. They met with Mustafa Bulent Ecevit, the prime minister of Turkey, and with Suleyman Demirel, the president of Turkey. They later visited with the Palestine legislative council.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR travels through Germany, France, Austria, and Italy during college: Munchen, Weisbaden, Rottenbuch, Bavaria, Nuremberg, Stuttgart, Frankfort, Innsbruck, Tyrol, Verona, and Venice. Tours through castles, churches, villages, cities, gardens, rivers, estates, and mountains. Stays with Demutter family. Some images are purchased souvenirs.

While in Manila, DR met with President Ferdinand Marcos and attended a Chase International Advisory Committee meeting. Most of the images are from a formal dinner at the Malacanang Palace. The Committee also held a dinner for the President and Imelda Marcos. Later, DR gave a talk at the Magsaysay Award Foundation and visited the Corregidor Island historical site.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR visit Poland and Hungary as part of the Chase Manhattan Bank's Corporate Program. In Poland, they met with Lech Walesa, the founder and leader of the Solidarity movement and recent Nobel Peace Prize winner. He later served as president of Poland. They also met with Jozef Glemp, Archbishop of Warsaw. Katherine Graham, publisher of the Washington Post, was also on the trip. In Hungary, they met with General Secretary Karoly Grosz and also with businessman Sandor Demjan.

did.unittitle: President Ronald Reagan's Visit to Kykuit
did.materialspec: Many of the images are blurry or the color is off tone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and Laurance Rockefeller hosted President Ronald Reagan and First Lady Nancy Reagan at Kykuit while they were in New York for the celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Statue of Liberty. The album includes extensive images of the tour of Kykuit and its grounds, with a dinner at Kykuit that was also attended by Mary French Rockefeller, Happy Rockefeller, and Peggy Rockefeller. The album also covers the regatta in New York Harbor that was part of the celebration on July 4. The President and the Rockefellers were aboard the yacht The Highlander for that event.

did.unittitle: Family of Man Award Ceremony for Prime Minister Lester B. Pearson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Society for the Family of Man awarded its annual prize to Canadian Prime Minister Lester Pearson. He was the 1957 Nobel Peace Prize recipient for his role in diffusing the Suez Crisis in Egypt. David Rockefeller served as Family of Man Award Dinner chair.

The Society for the Family of Man was an international and interfaith organization founded in 1963 by the Council of Churches of the City of New York to honor outstanding examples of excellence in society.

scopecontent.p: Jean Dubuffet's monumental sculpture "Group of Four Trees" was installed in front of Chase Manhattan Bank headquarters in August of 1972. An unveiling celebration took place in October, with the artist in attendance at a luncheon hosted by DR and a dinner hosted by Brooke Astor.

did.unittitle: Stone Barns Center and Property Album

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Album of images of the Stone Barns Center and surrounding property in Pocantico Hills, New York. Includes the ribbon-cutting ceremony in 2004, when the center was opened as a nonprofit farm and education center for food and agriculture. DR and members of his family led the ceremony and tours of the new facility. The album also includes earlier images of the property when the cattle farm (at Hudson Pines) held an auction.

did.unittitle: Dedication of the John D. Rockefeller Jr. Library, Brown University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Album of the dedication ceremony of the new John D. Rockefeller Jr. Library on the campus of Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island. It was JDR Jr's alma mater, and he provided substantial financial support to the school during his lifetime. David, Peggy, and Martha Baird Rockefeller all attended the event, and David spoke during the ceremony. Martha unveiled the plaque. The album includes quotes from the various speeches made.

accessrestrict.p: Material related to living members of the Rockefeller family is restricted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to the Ivory Coast (Cote d'Ivoire) and Liberia on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank. Images taken by Joseph Reed. DR met with Ivory Coast's first president, Felix Houphouet-Boigny, and Henry Konan Bedie, who later became president. Tours of the area and performances by local dance troupes. Tour of executive mansion and Chase Manhattan Bank branch in Monrovia, Liberia. The last few images appear to be taken in Maine with PR after DR returned.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Africa on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank, including stops in Botswana, Cameroon, Egypt, Malawi, Senegal, and South Africa. Image taken by Joseph Reed. DR met with Cameroon's first president, Ahmadou Ahidjo, and also with Egyptian diplomat Ashraf Ghorbal, Malawi politician J.Z.U. Tembo, Senegalese poet Leopold Senghor, and South Africa state president Nicolaas Diederich. Tours of each country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR trip to Philippines, Thailand, India, and Pakistan on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank. Images by Joseph Reed. DR met with Philippines president Ferdinand Marcos and his wife, Imelda. They also visited the Raymond Magsaysay Center in Manila. In India, they visited the Taj Mahal and sailed along the Ganges River. DR met with business leader/philanthropist Ratan Naval Tata. In Pakistan, DR met with U.S. Ambassador Henry A. Byroade.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to various European countries on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank, including Yugoslavia, Italy, and Germany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR trip to China on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank. Visit included Hong Kong, Beijing, the Forbidden City. DR met with Zhou Enlai, first premier of the People's Republic of China. He also spoke at an event with Francis Stankard of the Bank. Others in attendance included Joseph Reed, chief of staff to Mr. Rockefeller; Mimi Reed, his wife; Frank Stanton, head of the Bank's International Department; and James Pusey, a China scholar who served as Mr. Rockefeller's interpreter for the trip.

did.materialspec: The album is fragile and coming apart.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Venezuela and Peru with grandchildren. DR's friends Gustavo and Patricia Cisneros joined them. They visited rainforests and Angel Falls in Venezuela and Machu Picchu in Peru. Images of landscape, ruins, and botanicals.

did.unittitle: Compilation Album of Photos in David's Den

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This album was compiled in 2005 for David Rockefeller by his family to celebrate his 90th birthday. The snapshots show the framed family photographs that hung in David's den at Hudson Pines, his home in Pocantico Hills, New York. The various images include DR with his parents, siblings, wife, children, and grandfather from 1915 to approximately 2000.

did.unittitle: Book on Salon Mexicano (Mexico Room), Center for Inter-American Relations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Elegant picture book of the Manhattan headquarters of the Center for Inter-American Relations (now Americas Society) on Park Avenue. Given as a gift to DR from Carlos Espinosa Inglesias in gratitude for his leadership and support of the center. DR cofounded the center, and his support helped to furnish the Salon Mexicano. This is a printed book, not a photo album. Captions are in Spanish.

did.unittitle: International Advisory Committee Trip to Brazil, 1976

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR trip to Brazil on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank's International Advisory Committee. Photos taken by Joseph Reed. They traveled to Rio de Janiero and Brasilia. DR met with several Chase employees in those cities, as well as Mario Henrique Simonsen, the Brazilian Minister of Finance.
After the trip, they flew to their home in the Caribbean on St. Bart's, called Colombier, which is shown in the last few images in this album.

Locations include the grounds at Kykuit and Abeyton Lodge (Pocantico Hills), the gardens and the grounds near the Eyrie (Maine), and the house at 10 W. 54th Street in Manhattan. Image 255 is of John D. Rockefeller, Sr., visiting the Richmond Hill, New York, house very late in life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Africa, mostly Nigeria, with images taken by Joseph Reed. DR met with Nigerian leader Ado Bayero.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Egypt and Oman on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank. Images by Joseph Reed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR trip to Egypt, Jordan, Israel, Nepal, Indonesia, Australia, and Bora Bora on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank. Images by Joseph Reed. In Jordan, DR met with Prince Hassan bin Talal and Prime Minister Wasfi al-Tal, who was assassinated later that year. In Indonesia, DR likely met with Sultan Hamengkuwono IX. A few images of the construction of the Opera House in Sydney, Australia. A few images are in Waimea, Hawaii, at the end of the trip.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to several Middle East countries, including Jordan, Oman, Bahrain, the United Arab Emirates, and Egypt. They also stopped beforehand in Switzerland and Italy. Images by Joseph Reed. In Italy, DR met with banker Rodolfo Rinaldi. In Oman, he met with Sultan Qaboos bin Said al Said. In Bahrain, he met with Isa bin Salman al Khalifa, its first emir. In Egypt, he met with President Anwar Sadat.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Mexico, likely on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank. Images taken by Joseph Reed. DR met with Carlos Hank Gonzalez, a Mexican political leader.

scopecontent.p: DR trip to the Middle East, possibly to Saudi Arabia, on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank. At a large event, DR met with several prominent people, possibly some heads of state.

did.unittitle: Ringing Point, Seal Harbor, Maine Trip, 1975

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR visit to Ringing Point, their home in Seal Harbor, Maine, interspersed with some images of Manhattan. Images by Joseph Reed. They were joined in Maine by family and friends for sailing and a visit to the Abby Aldrich Rockefeller Garden. Includes a rare image of brother Nelson's tapestry of Picasso's "Guernica" in the boathouse gallery at NAR's Seal Harbor home, Anchorage. This is one of the few known images of the interior of the boathouse gallery.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip sailing in Sweden with Swedish banker Marc Wallenberg and his family. Images by Joseph Reed.

did.unittitle: Luncheon in Honor of the Prime Minister of Thailand

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Thailand on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank, where he attended a luncheon in honor of Prime Minister Thanom Kittikachorn. Also attended by Eugene Black (former head of the World Bank) and Thai leaders Amnuay Viravan, Thanat Khoman, and Pote Sarasin. Images by Joseph Reed.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Nigeria and Ivory Coast (Cote d'Ivoire) on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank. DR visited the Chase Manhattan Bank branch in Nigeria, probably in Lagos. DR met with Ado Abdullahi Bayero, emir of Kano, in Nigeria. Tours of neighborhoods, markets, and museum. DR met with Henry Konan Bedie, future president of Ivory Coast, and visited factories in the area. Boat tour and dance performances. See also Box 297 for additional images from Ivory Coast visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR and PR trip to Europe on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank, including stops in England, France, and Russia. Images were taken by Joseph Reed. DR was accompanied on part of the trip by John Hugo Loudon, former CEO of Royal Dutch Shell, and Henry Ford II. He met with Edmond de Rothschild and Valery Giscard d'Estaing while in France. The Russia portion of the trip was mostly sightseeing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to Morocco, Tunisia, Egypt, Jordan, and Israel, including a stop beforehand in Sydney, Australia. The trip was likely on behalf of Chase Manhattan Bank. Images by Joseph Reed. In Morocco, DR met with King Hassan II during a golf game and also met with Ambassador Hadj Abdelmajid Bengelloun. Album includes images of Egyptian and Tunisian residents plus a portrait of Habib Bourguiba Jr., a Tunisian ambassdor and son of the country's first president. In Jordan, DR met with Prince Hassan bin Talal. In Israel, DR met with Teddy Kollek, mayor of Jerusalem.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: DR trip to several Middle East coutries, including Israel, Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, Tunisia, and Algeria. Images by Joseph Reed. In Israel, DR met with Jerusalem mayor Teddy Kollek. In Egypt, he met with President Anwar Sadat. In Jordan, he met with Prince Hassan bin Talal. In Lebanon, he met with President Suleiman Frangieh. In Algeria, he met with political leader Ahmed Tewfik el Madani.

did.unittitle: Lincoln Center Album by Ezra Stoller

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Oversized printed album of formal photographs taken by Ezra Stoller of Lincoln Center in Manhattan and the architect's planning models of the various buildings. Images of interiors, exteriors, and models. Esto Photographics retains the rights to these images.
